channel.title: Runescape update
channel.description:
First among these is the expansion of the tool belt, which now has the capability to store hatchets and pickaxes all the way up to dragon level. You need no longer be without your trusty woodcutting or mining tools at any time - just right-click your best ones and select 'Add to tool belt'. You can add any compatible tool to the belt, regardless of whether you have the level to use it. It'll act as the highest-level tool you can use until you meet its requirements. Remember, though, that once an item's on your tool belt, you can't take it off again. Be sure you want to keep those valuable tools first! Here's a sample of the other tweaks we've made to RuneScape today: Ashes from fires and bonfires now appear for the person who created the bonfire first. TokHaar are now eligible targets when performing a Tzhaar slayer assignment for Kuradal. Certain high-level slayer targets have been made tougher and more aggressive: Aberrant spectres Living Rock Caverns creatures Mutated Jadinkos Waterfiends Dust devils Brutal green dragons have been made worthy of their title! Damage limitations against the Queen Black Dragon have been made slightly less severe, she's had her style-resistant forms rebalanced to work as intended, and hits as hard as she should. Dragons are now vulnerable to bolts, rather than arrows. Off-hand leaf-bladed swords can now drop form kurasks and turoths, and off-hand black weapons from a variety of sources. The Seercull bow now has a chance to drain your target's Magic level on hit - as with its pre-EoC special attack. Several of the newest basic abilities are now included in the rotation of the Momentum ability. The Knockout Aura now has a more clearly defined effect - increasing hit chance on NPC targets with low life points. The amount improves depending on the aura's tier. The Kalphite King's been rebalanced to make him more challenging. Many of his attacks and his summoned creatures are much more deadly - although it's also possible to deal more damage to him than before. Upgrading your multicannon to either the gold or royale version increases its cannonball capacity to 60 or 90, respectively. Grotworms - mature and ordinary - are now tougher and more effective at dealing damage. It's now possible to toggle the Quest Journal interface icon that appears post-completion of the Combat Academy back to the Combat Academy icon. The emotes filter will now remember which category is selected across log-in sessions. If you die, leave a gravestone and then log out, you will now be prompted on log-in that your gravestone was on a different world. There'll also be an option to log into that world to check if your gravestone is still active. This message will appear twice per gravestone on logging in, and will appear for up to one hour after the gravestone has spawned. You can chat to the Information Clerk in the Varrock Museum for prompts on what you can do to gain any remaining kudos.
My favorite part of this update is the toolbelt. The only problem I see is that someone may want to take their item out of it.

item.title: Runescape update
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

sk8rdude461:

My favorite part of this update is the toolbelt.

nice

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape update
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

[quote=“Elrick, post:28, topic:522003”][quote author=3lv3n snip3r link=topic=640511.msg4317198#msg4317198 date=1371687586]

The sad thing is I had already made this system on a rsps for somebody for the toolbelt with regular picks/hatchets good job copying jagex…

if you seriously believe that jagex “copied” you you’re mentally ill

they have developers who work on stuff and think of ideas daily, do you think they would happen to find one small private server and find this idea that was probably already thought of a long time ago and used it
[/quote]It’s funny cause I’m sure everyone here could list more than one item that has been copied from a rsps whether or not it has been suggested before is another story.

They might have taken some ideas, but they make it 100x better. For example, the aura wings.

Not that particular update though. Ever since the release of the toolbelt the community has been going “wait, how come DG allows you to update your toolbelt, but not in Gielenor (SP?)?” It’s been an age old question that Jagex decides to finally answer to after close to a year and a half. That’s pathetic.[/quote]
Jagex has a lot of projects going on with RuneScape and their other games. Don’t be surprised if content is being pushed back for a different release date. Mourning’s End Part 3 was supposed to come out this year, but because of the HTML 5 client, it has been pushed back to being released in 2014. Don’t forget, they are also working on the new skill, Divination, which is to be released this year. Some content that Jagex works on could take months at a time. For example, you know the quest, The World Wakes, it took Jagex either months or a year (forget which one was it) to make that quest. This was stated by Mod Mark in one of the BTS videos.

Read full topic

The sad thing is I had already made this system on a rsps for somebody for the toolbelt with regular picks/hatchets good job copying jagex…

[/quote]
youre retarded this type of “add with no return” system has been in WoW and many other games forever. I’m surprised Jagex did it because it isn’t really in the nature of their game[/quote]

The Fable games have it too. You can add an augment to your weapon to increase the power/add other effects (more XP, instills fear into people, less prone to scarring, etc) but you can never sell the weapon or remove the augment.
